Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, so i am fairly confident in my prediction being correct

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what that means is whatever liquidity telegrams bring to crypto, BTC will share in it. so like in any market, all new competitors end up helping the market leader by doing anything in that market

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: So in the end when a telegram is succesful at bringing mass adoption to the space that this will reflect on the rest of the cryptosphere as well?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems hard to avoid pulling bTC along and with that, the alts too

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
the thought originally come to me as I live on cryptocurrency for daily living.
I understand that not every day and time remains same always.
today we can consider btc up from it's starting years, but can we consider it greater in value for sure in coming years?
same goes to the holdings of eth, kmd etc. etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: first of all nothing is "for sure"

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
if that happens like the existing long term holdings goes down in a decade etc 
what should be my backup strategy etc?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: rebalance annually with the "liquidity holdings", the part of the portfolio that is in BTC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: say 50% in BTC (or the #1), then 16% in the 2, 3, 4th

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but only after BTC dominance is below 20%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this way, any new comer will be in the 4th rank for one year and then as it goes 10x, you end up with more than having had just BTC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course it can happen pretty fast, so whenever there is some "external" crypto that has all the right stuff, start shifting some bTC into it. likely it will be hard to miss this process happening

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: okay, in that case I need to switch to btc and eth some for sure üòÑ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, you need to have a liquidity portion of your portfolio that is only about liquiidity, 10% to 30%
